links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 8..1000
formula: Number of 17-subsequences of [ 1, n ] with just 4 contiguous pairs; g.f.: 55*(9+4*x)*x^8/(1-x)^14.C(n+1, 9)*C(n+4, 4) - _Zerinvary Lajos_, May 26 2005
mathematica: Table[55(n+1)Binomial[n+4,12],{n,8,30}] (* or *) CoefficientList[ Series[(55(4x+9))/(x-1)^14,{x,0,22}],x] (* From _Harvey P. Dale_, Nov 20 2011 *)
author: thi ngoc dinh (via _R. K. Guy_)
